page.title: 16BOOTHBY VILLAGE THE 1920'S
page.content: They had no milkman.They had to go to the farm that was near them with a metal can. He had a few pets and they were cats.This was to get rid off all the mice. They used to get all the water from a well and then boil it. They had no electricity so they used candles and paraffin lamps. They used to get 1pence-2pence for pocket money,which was a lot in those days.For 1pence you could get around 12 chews! After the children had left school they worked on a farm. There was a bus twice a week to go into town. They had 1 grocery shop in Boothby and this sold all the daily goods like our Mace or Spar shop.
